text: to get to the World Cup most New Yorkers
would buy a $1,400 plane ticket straight
to Brazil but I'm Seth Google the frugal
traveler so of course I found a cheaper
and more adventurous way there what else
this one I took the least expensive
flight I could find to South America
then made my way before places I'd never
been Guyana Suriname
French Guiana my goal to arrive in the
city of Natal in time to see the United
States team take on gun just a 334
dollar one-way flight later I was in
Guiana an english-speaking nation of
waterfalls and gold mines Guyana is
known for its untouched rainforest and
the isolated Kaieteur Falls I took a
hundred and forty five dollar day trip
it comes with an exciting flight and
gorgeous views and considered forgetting
the World Cup entirely and sticking it
out here but then I'd have miss Surinam
a former Dutch colony and this
multiculturalism is reflected in the
cuisine at a small restaurant
I tried cellto a version of an
Indonesian soup
it's got shredded chicken bean sprouts
fried potatoes and onions and garlic
next I got a cut-rate deal on a non
luxurious eco resort on the upper
Surinam River it was run by Nelson
chiapoe who's a maroon an ethnic group
descended from 18th century runaway
slaves I was there with a Hindustani sir
enemies family and let me tell you these
people know how to cook and how to have
fun
then I was off to French Guiana which is
amazingly still a part of France we have
the same oniy the same language to send
those this needs some explanation see
getting a boat in Sarnia cross a river
and end up in the European Union yep
they even have Huan juries
although you'd better get there early on
the bus to the Brazilian border
I met chordoma a Brazilian born
grandmother who lives in France like the
rest of France across the Atlantic she
was with her son and granddaughters they
were pretty cute
like me when I'm a prefers adventure
over convenience I'd finally met someone
who shares my travel philosophy Xena
corny I see a friend jeff alessi with a
mini I have the next leg of the journey
was across the mouth of the Amazon from
I'm apostate 2 Bil'in everyone lounged
on these cool hammocks I met some nice
families and the sunset was beautiful
there was even some excitement when a
family in a canoe hopped on board to
sell shrimp we all watched as just after
dark
they released themselves back to the
river and when night fell there was the
game pretty good TV reception for the
Amazon once we got to bail in it was off
to the airport for my final leg and I
made it after 16 days of 4 plane rides 3
mini buses for boat rides 3 collective
taxis 1 4x4 pickup and multiple hammock
naps I was finally united with my fellow
American fans
but seriously did you guys fly here
pretty bored
Oh
